title: Please, if you really want to rework Darius and Garen, don't f*cking ruin them.
body:
Please, for all that is sacred, don't put as much counterplay in them as there is in someone like Sion where the enemies can always f*cking sidestep your ult unless they were CC'd before or you caught them in a very small angle in which they cannot escape.

It's almost never up to me to land the ult, it's up to my enemies to dodge it. 

Anyway, back to Darius & Garen.

They are **lane bullies**, they have always been.

They are supposed to make the enemy laner feel like shit unless the enemy laner is a lane bully himself.

As a trade-off, they don't scale to late game aswell as other top laners and despite being somewhat strong in a 1v1 or 1v2 scenario, they are still inferior versions of someone like Jax.

But we all know what's going to happen. 

Garen will probably lose his Silence simply because of "muh counterplay".

And Noxian Guillotine will have a "can only be casted on Slowed targets with at least 3 stacks of Hemorrage after 5 seconds of being in combat that will root Darius in place and force Jarvan to record a One night stand with Fiora with Teemo and Evelynn watching it in the background" slapped on it's tooltip.

Cho'gath

Am I the only one that thinks Cho'gath is basically freelo?

He has a ton of sustain on top of the offensive masteries that you get for killing minions, so even poke lanes don't really work that well.

He has a lot of CC with stupid range and are so easy to hit, and he can easily knock-up, slow, and silence an entire team for 5 seconds of CC total, all doing damage as well.

If he gets ahead he's impossible to kill since he's a tank, and can easily just Q > R the enemy ADC.

If he's behind he can still instakill most squishy people and since his ult does true damage, it isn't hard for him to kill tanks either. Even if not, he still has a ridiculous amount of CC.

I've heard mixed opinions. Some think he's overpowered but has counterplay, some think he's balanced.

> [{quoted}](name=A Miss Fortune,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AUs9uVbh,comment-id=0000000100000000,timestamp=2015-07-31T17:39:32.924+0000)
>
> Am I the only one that thinks Cho'gath is basically freelo?
> 
> He has a ton of sustain on top of the offensive masteries that you get for killing minions, so even poke lanes don't really work that well.

You don't beat a Cho'gath by randomly poking him whenever your skills are off cooldown. He doesn't give a shit. You're supposed to beat his FACE in early on, and then zone him from farm. If he can't farm, he can't heal. Denying farm is the number one thing you can do to fuck Cho up early on, since he loses out on both gold and healing. Unfortunately some people aren't as aggressive as they should be against him.
> 
> He has a lot of CC with stupid range and are so easy to hit, and he can easily knock-up, slow, and silence an entire team for 5 seconds of CC total, all doing damage as well.

Q does have good range but it's delayed, along with the short foot stomp animation he does beforehand. Silence is good too, but he can only fire it in one direction and hope that he hits people. Cho excels in teamfights for this very reason, you want to know how to counter it? 

DON'T FUCKING GROUP UP IN A BALL. Cho's eyes instantly light up at that. You need to spread out and force him to make a decision. 
> 
> If he gets ahead he's impossible to kill since he's a tank, and can easily just Q > R the enemy ADC.

Cho's a slow fatass who has to deal with an entire frontline if he ever wants to kill the enemy carry. If said carry dies, then that's either shitty positioning on their part, or their teammates can't peel at all. 

If he's tanky, he doesn't have to damage to nuke someone. If he does have said damage, he's actually possible to kill. Really. Pay attention to his build. AP Cho might LOOK menacing, but that's an illusion that he wants to you believe. If multiple people dump on him, he's going to die. 
> 
> If he's behind he can still instakill most squishy people and since his ult does true damage, it isn't hard for him to kill tanks either. Even if not, he still has a ridiculous amount of CC.

If you kick Cho in the balls hard enough, he won't have the damage to kill anything. And what the fuck are you saying that 'because his ult does true damage, he can kill tanks too'. True damage is COUNTERED by building health, something that tanks do? Quite often? Cho also lacks any %health damage in his kit. So guess what, if you buy a Banshee's Veil or Spirit Visage, you're neutering his damage hard. 
> 
> I've heard mixed opinions. Some think he's overpowered but has counterplay, some think he's balanced.

Cho's one of the most balanced champions in the game. He trades mobility and dueling potential for amazing AOE disruption, sustain, and strong base damages on his abilities. I wrote a longass guide on him, so if you really want my insight on how to counter him, I can post the link and you can look at the lane and jungle matchups.

The guy with a broken 650 point and click true damage ult that scales off 70% of his AP and also indicates when it will kill the target has no dueling potential lol?

So basically he trades mobility for everything else in the game? CC, damage, sustain, tankiness, range.

Feast doesn't do 650 base true damage until he's level 16, and by then, EVERY CHAMPION in the game will have much more health than that. Even the squishy carries will have anywhere from 1800-2000 health or so. That's basically a third of their health bar if Cho decides to go full tank. Enemy tanks will have more health and thus will take less %damage from it. 

And yes, Cho will usually build some AP and make that true damage higher, but he can only hit one champion with it. He's not Captain KillSteal here {{champion:122}} . 

Cho has low dueling potential because he has no combat steroids. Olaf's W, Poppy's W, Trundle's W, these will all instantly boost their respective champions DPS and make them more powerful. Cho doesn't have something like that. This makes landing his CC extremely important, because if he misses, he's a sitting duck. 

His sustain also falls off pretty badly after laning phase. He only heals when he (HE) kills something. He has no on-hit sustain like Irelia and Nasus. In teamfights, as long as you stay away from large waves of friendly minions, Cho has no sustain whatsoever for the fight.

tl;dr

cho'gath falls off late game, but since he's also a tank and has a long ranged AoE slow, knockup, and silence he doesn't really fall off and pretty much has everything but mobility.

"I don't feel like discussing this anymore, I'm just going to keep my original opinion and ignore anyone defending another one."

Because it feels like you're just trying to defend a champion you love, which I understand perfectly, though you relatively provide no actual weaknesses aside from him having no mobility.

Him having not dueling potential is a lie, since he can 100-0 most squishy people and his ultimate allows him to not really struggle with tanks that much. Obviously there are matchups that he loses to, though making a mistake post-6 usually can result in a death and make Cho'gath even more difficult to deal with.

Him falling off late game is just totally inaccurate since he can instakill any ADC late game unless they're hypermobile freelo like Vayne, and even if he can't he still has more than enough tankiness and CC to provide for his team that he never really falls off.

> [{quoted}](name=A Miss Fortune,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AUs9uVbh,comment-id=0000000100000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-08-02T03:55:20.431+0000)
>
> Because it feels like you're just trying to defend a champion you love, which I understand perfectly, though you relatively provide no actual weaknesses aside from him having no mobility.
> 

Okay, here are a few more.

He reverse-snowballs if you can kill him post-6. He loses ult stacks on death, and that means he walks out of base with less max health. And that makes him easier to kill. You shouldn't just let Cho'Gath get max Feast stacks in lane, but some people just see his sustain and think 'well fuck this, he's not going to die' and leave him alone. That's what he wants. You need to GET IN HIS FACE. 

Unfortunately, some champs just don't have the early damage to kill him.

You have to treat the lane like Nasus, but instead of preventing the dog from getting stronger damage-wise, you're preventing Cho from turning into a brick.

And while it's not _technically_ a weakness, I consider his Vorpal Spikes a second passive. You don't need to turn them off, so he REALLY has 2 passives, 2 normal skills, and Feast. And due to the power creep of the game, his kit is lacking in comparison with newer champs. If Cho were released today, I guarantee you Vorpal Spikes would be the second part of his passive, and he'd have a new E entirely.

> Him having not dueling potential is a lie, since he can 100-0 most squishy people and his ultimate allows him to not really struggle with tanks that much. Obviously there are matchups that he loses to, though making a mistake post-6 usually can result in a death and make Cho'gath even more difficult to deal with.

I don't think you get the difference between dueling and bursting. You're talking about bursting. If Cho bought AP and is somewhat fed, then yes his BURST combo can kill squishies. And shouldn't it? He causes a huge-ass tremor, screams your ears off, and then EATS you. He's alien Godzilla, it makes thematic sense. 

I'm talking about dueling, AKA 'sitting there auto-attacking each other'. Cho can only duel if he builds specific items, like Wits End. Otherwise, champs that have lifesteal and magic resist can absorb that first chunk of damage and then continue to beat his face in, and then he's boned because he's slow and fat. 
> 
> Him falling off late game is just totally inaccurate since he can instakill any ADC late game unless they're hypermobile freelo like Vayne, and even if he can't he still has more than enough tankiness and CC to provide for his team that he never really falls off.

I read my earlier posts and I didn't claim that he falls off as a whole lategame. I said his sustain falls off, and it does because he's not always sitting next to a big wave of enemy minions. In teamfights, he has next to no sustain and any damage you do to him will stick.

Cho's an anti-carry, you're right. Any opposing ADC's need to watch for Rupture, and once you see it go off, get out of the way. Then afterwards, your team needs to engage when it's on CD, because now Cho only has half of his CC available for the fight.

The silence is the only form of crowd control that Garen has. The only way he can get more is to build a slowing item like Randuins or Frozen Mallet. That's why he needs it. Other top laners have just as much bullying potential and loads more CC (Pantheon, Wukong, etc. ). Garen is special because he has loads of resistances, loads of sustain, and a touch of soft cc. Literally he is a damage sponge that is successful because he can run in, soak damage, silence a priority, run out, heal up. Take away the silence and Garen cannot trade NEARLY as effectively in lane (which is already hard in a lot of matchups if the enemy knows how to control a minion wave), and he runs the risk of being blown up either in the midst of his damage soaking or on his way out of a fight.

But should Garen have CC, or instead more of a direct way of fighting the enemy? I don't know, I feel like Garen should kind of fulfill the knight-warrior role. He should be a tank by all means, though I feel like he should also be given access to damage aside from just spinning.

Well Garen's ult, now and after the changes, is a MASSIVE amount of damage. Right now it's good for dealing with squishies after surviving crowd control and tanks mid-game and in team fights. With the changes, I feel like Garen will become a serious split-push threat. 
"Oh Garen is split pushing. He has good waveclear. We need to send someone to deal with him. Do we send our tank with tp? Yea that would be fine if he could stop the push but he can't. He'll just get shoved out of lane. Do we send our mid laner to waveclear? No we need him for fights. Let's send 3 people because that's the only way we can stop him and he will probably still get at least 1 kill because of the insane ult damage. GG their team pushed our nexus while we barely killed Garen."
Well, thank god.
